content: this is a summary of a civil case that took place in the taurage district court the court has made a final decision regarding the division of matrimonial property between the defendant and plaintiff 2 the defendant is responsible for paying various fees while plaintiff 2 is responsible for paying stamp duty the court has assigned the defendants personal property and divided the matrimonial property accordingly the court has also recognized the defendant as personally liable for a debt owed to the state tax inspectorate the text refers to specific articles in the civil code related to matrimonial property the applicant is seeking the dissolution of their marriage and the division of matrimonial property the court allows the action in full and establishes that the parties were married and have minor children the court finds that the defendant is the registered owner of the dwelling house and its annexes the applicant requests the division of matrimonial property and the recovery of a debt owed to the debt collector the court orders the defendant to pay the costs of secondary legal aid and other fees the court grants the application in full dissolving the marriage and dividing the immovable property between the parties the defendant is also ordered to pay the stamp duty and other costs

metadata.cost: 110.00 EUR (stamp duty) + 13.28 EUR (court fees) + 51.00 EUR (professional fees) to be borne by the defendant; 867.00 EUR (stamp duty) to be borne by the plaintiff
